remedies.name: Empathic listening practice
remedies.description: Once a week, offer 10â€“15 minutes of focused, non-judgmental listening to a loved one without interrupting.
remedies.safety_notes: Do this only in emotionally safe relationships; do not force conversations that feel unsafe.

remedies.name: Gentle act of service
remedies.description: Once a week, perform a small act of service or care for someone outside yourself to soften emotional rigidity in relationships.
remedies.safety_notes: Help only within your energy and time limits; avoid over-giving.

remedies.name: Loving-kindness meditation
remedies.description: Spend a few minutes sending simple wishes of well-being first to yourself and then to close people, such as "May I be peaceful, may they be peaceful."
remedies.safety_notes: If thinking of certain people is triggering, keep the practice focused on yourself or neutral figures.

remedies.name: Relationship-supportive charity
remedies.description: Make small, heartfelt contributions to causes that support families, children, or community harmony.
remedies.safety_notes: Choose reputable causes and give only what feels comfortable.

remedies.name: Soft communication intention
remedies.description: Before important conversations, take a minute to silently set the intention to speak honestly and kindly, and to listen fully.
remedies.safety_notes: Use this to support, not to suppress genuine feelings that need to be expressed.

remedies.name: Heart-centered breathing
remedies.description: Spend a few minutes breathing slowly while placing attention on the heart area, inviting warmth and openness towards yourself and others.
remedies.safety_notes: If difficult emotions surface, slow down and ground yourself; consider talking to a trusted person or professional.

remedies.name: Shared meal or tea time
remedies.description: From time to time, invite someone you care about to share a simple meal or cup of tea with the intention of relaxed connection.
remedies.safety_notes: Only do this in relationships where you feel reasonably safe and respected.
